info.title: Triple API
info.description:
# Overview

The Triple API enables Partners to integrate with the Triple platform and
Customers (consumers or card holders) to access offer content.

Connecting to our environment requires proper credentials.
See the Authentication section for more details.

Additionally, triple content will be placed on a client-specific S3 bucket
for ingestion. Please contact your triple client engagement manager for more
information and to setup access.

## Concepts

### Partner Types

**Portfolio Managers** are, generally, companies that provide services to
multiple separate financial institutions such as regional banks, credit
unions, or companies running open-enrollment rewards programs. These
partners manage a *portfolio* of *Publishers*.

**Publishers** are, generally, banks or companies that offer one or more
payment *Card Programs* to individuals.

**Content Providers** are the companies that publish *Offers* on the
Triple platform.

### Card Programs

**Card Programs** represent a logical grouping of issued payment cards. A
Publisher will create a Card Program for each debit or credit card offering,
such as miles or cash back. For Publishers that are not Banks/Card Issuers
(for example, a third-party rewards program), Card Programs can provide a
simply way to organize Card Accounts.

**Card Accounts** represent the account connected to a payment card.
Multiple physical cards may be associated with a single Card Account, such
as when there are multiple authorized users or cards are replaced as lost,
stolen, or expired. Each **Transaction** reported to Triple must specify
the Card Account to which it belongs.

**Consumers** represent individual card holders. A Consumer may be
associated with multiple Card Accounts across a Publisher's Card Programs,
such as when an individual has both a "miles" and a "cash back" card with
the same bank. Multiple Consumers may be associated with the same Card
Account, such as when there are multiple authorized users.

### External IDs

Triple requires Partners to specify IDs for the entities they create through
the Triple API. Generally, these "external" IDs only need to be unique
within the scope of an object's parent entity, but we encourage the use of
UUIDs to avoid confusion. External IDs must be stable and *never sensitive*,
as they cannot be updated through the API.

Triple will also create a unique ID for each entity created through the API.

## Partner API

Most integration effort will focus on calls to endpoints under the
`/partner` path. These endpoints will allow Content Providers to create
and update Offer content and Publishers to register card holders, retrieve
Offer content for display, and submit Transactions for Rewards.

The exposed APIs allow developers to authenticate to the triple service,
register and unregister (delete) cards, retrieve affiliate offer URLs,
submit transactions, and see user notifications delivered over webhooks.

## Affiliate Links

The `/affiliate-link-api` endpoint will soon be updated to integrate with
the Partner API. However, the process for generating a link and redirecting
the user to the affiliate website will remain generally the same.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

post.description: Generate a link for an (online) affiliate Offer. The link is specific to a single Card Account (cardholder), in order to attribute the purchase to the correct account.

put.description:
This endpoint is superseded by
[`POST /partner/transactions`](#operation/createTransaction).

Submit a transaction for processing.
The `card_id` and `merchant_id` need to exist before submitting a transaction.

The success response content returned by this API is misleading.
This API call initiates transaction processing,
but the response body says "Processed".

post.description:
Note: This is not a valid triple API endpoint.

Triple can send reward notification messages
to a webhook setup by a triple partner. This describes what our
outbound webhook call will provide to the triple partner.

The `transaction_amount` and `reward_amount` fields are passed as
strings but always contain decimal numerics.

example.message: Hi, your recent $19.99 purchase at Acme Tools has earned you 2.00 points!

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the call.

get.description:
Returns a list of Card Accounts, optionally filtered.

Currently, this endpoint has a hard limit of returning up to 1,000
results. Future API releases may support paging results.

patch.description:
(Alpha - this endpoint is subject to breaking change)

Enroll, un-enroll, or close a Card Account.

Card Accounts must be enrolled at the time of a transaction and not
closed at the time of distribution in order to receive Rewards.

The date of enrollment defaults to the current date at UTC-12. The date
of un-enrollment defaults to the current date at UTC+12. (This is to
accommodate the possibility of a customer's current local date being
different than the server's.)

A future API release will address the edge case of unenrolling and then
re-enrolling an account within the same day.

parameters.name: include_expired
parameters.description:
When `true`, the results will include Activations up to 90 days old
for Offers that have expired, in addition to all active Offers.

get.description:
Returns a list of Card Programs, optionally filtered.

This list can be used to find Card Programs' ID given an external ID.

patch.description:
Updates a Card Program.

Currently, only the name of a Card Program may be updated.

get.description:
Checks to see if the API is healthy. Returns information about the API
version.

Returns a list of Merchants, optionally filtered.

This list can be used to find a Merchant's ID given an external ID.

Returns a list of Merchant Locations, optionally filtered.

This list can be used to find a Merchant Location's ID given an external
ID.

Search for offers, optionally by category.

The default behavior of this endpoint is the null query, which fetches
triple offers recommendations based on a Customer's geo-location,
transaction history, and offer interactions.

However, a Customer can also search directly for offers with ad hoc text
queries and/or by faceting on offer category. This action replaces the null
query with search terms and/or one or more offer category facets.

For example, a Customer may search for 'italian food' in plain text and
select the 'FOOD' offer category facet.

Search results are paginated, using the `page_size` and `page_offset` parameters.
For example, page_size=10 and page_offset=30 corresponds to the 4th page
of 10 offers.

Note that Offer Display Rules are enforced against all search results.

post.description:
Search for offers, optionally by category.

The default behavior of this endpoint is the null query, which fetches
triple offers recommendations based on a Customer's geo-location,
transaction history, and offer interactions.

However, a Customer can also search directly for offers with ad hoc text
queries and/or by faceting on offer category. This action replaces the null
query with search terms and/or one or more offer category facets.

For example, a Customer may search for 'italian food' in plain text and
select the 'FOOD' offer category facet.

Search results are paginated, using the `page_size` and `page_offset` parameters.
For example, page_size=10 and page_offset=30 corresponds to the 4th page
of 10 offers.

Note that Offer Display Rules are enforced against all search results.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Triple ID of the Offer

get.description:
Get details and Merchant Locations for a given Offer.

To include physical Merchant Locations in the response, you must either
include the `Geo-Position` header or specify the `ml_id` parameter one
or more times.

post.description:
Get details and Merchant Locations for a given Offer.

To include physical Merchant Locations in the response, you must either
include the `Geo-Position` header or specify the `ml_id` parameter one
or more times.

get.description: Returns a list of Offer Display Rules, optionally filtered.

Returns a list of Offers, optionally filtered.

This list can be used to find am Offer's ID given an external ID.

Returns a list of Publishers, optionally filtered.

Currently, this endpoint has a hard limit of returning up to 1,000
results. Future API releases may support paging results.

patch.description:
Updates a Publisher.

Currently, only the Publisher name and address may be updated.

get.description:
Lists Rewards and associated Transaction details that triple has matched
to active Offers in the last 90 days.

post.description:
Transitions a Reward from `PENDING_MERCHANT_APPROVAL` to the
`PENDING_MERCHANT_FUNDING` status.

allOf.description:
Indicates what error or errors were encountered while
processing this request. In addition to malformed JSON
entities, the API may return an error if:
* The Reward status cannot be transitioned.
* The Transaction ID or Offer ID is invalid.

post.description:
Transitions a Reward from `PENDING_MERCHANT_APPROVAL` to the
`DENIED_BY_MERCHANT` status.

The Merchant must provide a reason for denying the Reward in the
`notes` field of this request.

allOf.description:
Indicates what error or errors were encountered while
processing this request. In addition to malformed JSON
entities, the API may return an error if:
* The Reward status cannot be transitioned.
* The Transaction ID or Offer ID is invalid.

post.description:
Important notes:
- *Do not submit authorizations* as purchases.
- The amount for a Purchase transaction *should not include cashback*
  if it was part of the transaction.
- Transactions must be uploaded *within 3 days* of when they take place.

card_account_id.description: Partner-defined, external Card Account ID. If the Card Account does not exist for the specified Program, it will be created with an "enrolled" date of the current day (UTC-12).

offer_id.description: Triple Offer ID, provided by the API or offers file.

program_id.description: The partner-defined, external Card Program ID.

publisher_id.description: The partner-defined, external Publisher ID. Required for Portfolio Managers.

Amount.description: An amount in dollars with decimal cents

message.description: The message for the card holder

merchant_name.description: The full name of the merchant offering the reward

transaction_id.description: The matching transaction which caused the reward to be triggered

reward_amount.description: The amount of the reward earned

url.description: A URL for a link for the consumer

message.description: A description of a failure or of the successful action taken

Address.description:
A physical address in the world.

Addresses may be normalized by Triple for countries with known,
standardized formatting rules.

complete_address.description:
The complete address, as would be written out for mail
delivery or route navigation.

postal_code.description: ZIP Code, ZIP+4, or postal code

status.description:
- `ENROLLED` - The account is enrolled for rewards
- `NOT_ENROLLED` - The account is not enrolled for rewards
- `CLOSED` - The account is closed and cannot receive rewards

CardBIN.description: The Bank Identification Number (BIN) of a payment card.

CardAccountIdentifier.description:
Must provide either a `card_account_id`, or
an `external_card_account_id`, optionally with
a `publisher_external_id` and `card_program_id`
specified if the `external_card_account_id`
does not uniquely resolve.

name.description: Display name of the Card Program

card_bins.description:
The Bank Identification Numbers for cards in this Card Program.

Providing these values helps Triple validate Transactions during
reward processing and enforce card requirements during purchases
through Affiliate Offers.

CreatedAt.description: RFC 3339 date time when this entity was created

CurrencyCode.description:
3-character ISO-4217 currency code. Note that some values are not
supported, particularly test and fund codes.

EntityId.description: The Triple-defined ID for the entity

Error.title: Default error template
Error.description:
Indicates what error or errors were encountered while
processing this request.

ExternalId.description:
Partner-provided, external ID. External IDs should be **stable** and
**never sensitive**.

External IDs do not need to be globally unique, but we encourage
the use of UUIDs. They must be unique for this entity type within
the scope of its parent entity, if it has one.

To protect against accidental inclusion of sensitive personal
information, external IDs may not be 9-digit numbers or use the
US Tax ID format (###-##-####).

FilterCategory.description: An industry segment that best categorizes an offer

FilterOnlinePhysical.description: Indicates if an offer is online, in-person or both

FilterType.description: The type of offer (eg. Affiliate, Card-Linked, etc.)

GeoTarget.description: Cardholder location information used for OfferDisplay

api_version.description: The semantic version of the API

build.description: A commit hash of the build

Merchant.description:
A Merchant (or brand) is a business or retailer with one or more
Merchant Locations (online or physical locations). Consumers who make
purchases at Merchants with valid Offers may receive Rewards.

description.description: The description of the Merchant Category Code

MerchantLocation.description:
A specific, singular physical or online store for a particular Merchant.

Merchant Locations should specify Processor Merchant IDs (MIDs) so that
Transactions at those locations can be more accurately matched to
Offers.

location_name.description:
The name of the Merchant Location. If not specified, the Merchant
name is used.

is_online.description: Indicates whether or not this is an online location.

email.description: An email address for the location.

phone_number.description: A phone number for the location.

logo_url.description: A link to the merchant's logo

category_tags.description: A single-space-delimited collection of Offer tags

currency_code.description:
The currency for the offer reward, minimum spend requirement, and
maximum reward limitations. The value is an ISO-4217 currency code.

category_mccs.description: The Merchant Category Codes included for a categorical offer.

description.description: A long-form text description of or promotional content for an offer

effective_date.description: The first date on which the offer is valid.

expiration_date.description: The last date on which the offer is valid.

is_activated.description: True if an offer has been activated.

headline.description:
The headline or title for the offer, appropriate for top-level
display.

reward_rate.description:
The reward percentage if this offer has a reward_type
of percentage, the amount will be between 0.0 and 100.0

reward_type.description:
Indicates whether this offer is for a fixed or percentage-based
amount.

reward_value.description:
The fixed reward value if this offer has a reward_type
of fixed, the amount must be greater than or equal to 0

type.description: The type of offer - card-linked, affiliate, categorical, etc.

minimum_spend.description:
The minimum monetary value that a cardholder must spend for a
transaction to qualify for this offer.

maximum_reward_per_transaction.description:
The maximum monetary value a cardholder may earn for a
percentage-based reward on any single transaction.

maximum_reward_cumulative.description:
The maximum monetary value a cardholder may earn for this offer
across multiple transactions.

max_redemptions.description:
The maximum number of times a cardholder may receive a reward for
this offer over a given period of time.

The numerator of this value is the number of times a reward can be
earned. The denominator is the period of time over which the limit
is enforced.

Time periods must conform to the following restrictions:
- a period of years (Y) must be 1-3
- a period of months (M) must be 1-36
- a period of weeks (W) must be 1-156
- a period of days (D) must be 1-365

activation_required.description:
Indicates whether or not a cardholder must activate this offer prior
to transacting and qualifying for the offer reward; If true,
transactions that occur prior to the date of the cardholder
activating the offer will not qualify for the offer's reward.

activation_duration_in_days.description:
If specified, the number of days (inclusive) for which an offer
activation is valid. If a transaction falls outside of this
duration, it will not qualify for the offer. The day of activation
is considered day 1. So, if a cardholder activates an offer on
Monday with a 3 day duration, they must make their transaction on or
before Wednesday.

terms_and_conditions.description:
Terms and conditions for the offer, not inclusive of other limits
specified by the offer properties, such as minimum spend, excluded
dates, or activation requirements.

valid_day_parts.description:
If specified, the days of the week and times during which the offer
is valid. If unspecified, the offer is valid for all days and times
during the week.

excluded_dates.description:
Dates for which the offer is not valid. Transactions made on these
dates will not qualify for a reward.

activation_expires_on.description:
The last date on which this Offer Activation is valid. If absent,
the activation is valid until the Offer expires.

enabled.description: Indicates whether this rule is currently enabled.

oneOf.description: An MCC range. Only valid if `MCC_IN_RANGE` is specified.

merchant_name.description: The name of the merchant associated with this offer.

OfferLocationGeo.description: The complete address, latitude and longitude of a Merchant Location

ProcessorMID.description:
The Processor Merchant ID (MID) is an unique number used to identify
the business for credit and debit card payment processing. Physical
locations and online retailers may have multiple MIDs, even for the same
processor network, usually for different departments or checkouts.

assumed_name.description: Assumed legal name of the Publisher

revenue_share.description:
The percent-based revenue share of this Publisher.

Only Portfolio Managers may set this value for their Publishers. If
set, this will override the value set at the Portfolio Manager level.

Radius.description:
The distance in meters from the provided location. Default value
of `35000m` is adjusted according to population density of a location
(ie. Rural locations will target a broader search radius than urban
locations).

external_id.description: Partner-provided, external ID. External IDs should be stable and never sensitive. External IDs do not need to be globally unique, but we encourage the use of UUIDs. They must be unique for Transactions within the scope of the associated Card Account.

local_date.description: The local date on which the transaction occurred

local_time.description:
The local time (HH:mm[:ss[.SSSSSS]]) at which the transaction
occurred.

debit.description: Whether this is a debit or credit

amount.description:
The amount of the transaction. An error will be returned if the
field contains fractional amounts smaller than those allowed by the
transaction's currency code.

description.description: The transaction description, usually the merchant name

matching_status.description:
The status of Triple matching the Transaction to Offers.

- `HISTORIC_TRANSACTION` - The Transaction was more than 3 days old
  when it was submitted to Triple. It is not eligible for a Reward.
- `NOT_APPLICABLE` - The Transaction is not a Purchase or Return,
  or is otherwise not eligible for a Reward.
- `NOT_ENROLLED` - The Card Account was not enrolled for Rewards at
  the time of the Transaction.
- `QUEUED` - The Transaction is waiting for Offer matching.
- `NO_ACTIVE_OFFER` - The Transaction did not match any active Offer
  or meet Offer terms.
- `MATCHED` - The Transaction was matched to offers and is
  potentially eligible for a reward. See `reward_details` for more
  information.

amount.description:
The calculated reward amount for this Transaction and Offer.
This field may be negative if the Transaction is a Return that
has resulted in an adjustment to a previous reward.

status.description:
The Reward status.
- `REJECTED` - The Transaction did not meet the offer terms.
- `PENDING_MERCHANT_APPROVAL` - The Transaction is waiting for the
  Merchant or Content Provider to approve or deny the Reward.
- `DENIED_BY_MERCHANT` - The Merchant or Content Provider denied
  the Reward. A reason will be included in `reward_details`.
- `PENDING_MERCHANT_FUNDING` - The Reward was approved and is
  awaiting funding by the Merchant.
- `PENDING_TRANSFER_TO_PUBLISHER` - The Reward is funded and funds
  are awaiting distribution to the Publisher.
- `DISTRIBUTED_TO_PUBLISHER` - Reward funds have been sent to the
  Publisher.
- `DISTRIBUTED_TO_CARDHOLDER` - The Publisher has reported that the
  Reward has been given to the cardholder.

rejection.description:
The reason this matched offer was not applied to the
Transaction.

notes.description:
A text description or additional information about why the
Offer was rejected or denied by the merchant. This field is
not intended to be displayed to cardholders.

TransactionType.description:
The type of transaction. Triple will only calculate offers based on a
history of Purchases and Refunds.

UpdatedAt.description: RFC 3339 date time when this entity was most recently updated

end_date.name: end_date
end_date.description: Include only transactions through this date (YYYY-mm-dd)

matched.name: matched
matched.description:
Include only transactions matched to an active offer. See the Reward
Details for more information, such as whether an award is approved.

start_date.name: start_date
start_date.description: Include only transactions starting from this date (YYYY-mm-dd)

local_time_offset.description:
The local, UTC time (zone) offset for the Customer. This is
used to determine the start of the Offer Activation.

ml_id.description:
The Triple ID of a related Merchant Location whose details should be
included in the response.

text_query.description: Text query used to search offers.

page_size.description: The number of offers returned for the current page of search results.

page_offset.description: The beginning index for the current page of offers.

apply_filter.description:
Applies filters against any of the following offer fields:
`type` | `category` | `mode`

card_last_4.description:
The last four digits of the Primary Account Number (PAN) of
the card used for this Transaction.

transaction_date.description:
The date on or timestamp at which the transaction
took place.
(YYYY-mm-dd['T'HH:MM:ss[.SSS][Z|[+-]HH:MM]])

triple_auth.description:
The triple API uses OAuth2 with a client id and client secret.

The URL to get an OAuth2 token is here:
https://auth.partners.dev.tripleupdev.com/oauth2/token

This is an example of how to call the API from the command line.
Code will need to be developed by the partner in their servers.

```bash
# Fetch an access token
TOKEN_URL=https://auth.partners.dev.tripleupdev.com/oauth2/token
CLIENT_ID=fake
CLIENT_SECRET=another-fake

SCOPE=api.tripleup.com/partner.publishers
curl -X POST $TOKEN_URL \
  --user $CLIENT_ID:$CLIENT_SECRET \
  --data grant_type=client_credentials \
  --data-urlencode "scope=$SCOPE"

# Use an access token
ACCESS_TOKEN=the-long-access-token-string-returned-above
API_URL=https://api.partners.dev.tripleupdev.com/
curl -X GET "$API_URL/v1/publishers" \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN"
```

See also the _Client credentials grant_ section at the bottom of this
[AWS blog post](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mobile/understanding-amazon-cognito-user-pool-oauth-2-0-grants/).

scopes.api.tripleup.com/partner.portfolios: Manage Portfolio Manager details and portfolios of Publishers
scopes.api.tripleup.com/partner.publishers:
Manage Publisher details, Card Programs, Consumers, Card Accounts,
and Transactions
scopes.api.tripleup.com/partner.view_offers: View recommended Offers, search Offers, and view Offer details
scopes.api.tripleup.com/partner.content_provide:
Manage Content Provider details, Merchants, Merchant Locations,
and Offers

tags.name: Card Accounts
tags.description:
Operations related to managing Card Accounts.

A Card Account represents the account for which payment cards (credit or
debit cards) are issued. A Transaction will belong to a single Card
Account.

If a card is replaced or reissued (because it was lost or stolen), the
Card Account itself should not change.

Card Accounts may have a status of "unenrolled" or "enrolled" for Rewards.
A Card Account may only receive a Reward if it has a status of "enrolled"
on the day of the eligible Transaction.

tags.name: Card Programs
tags.description:
A **Card Program** is logical grouping of Card Accounts. Typically, this
is a specific type of card offering by a Publisher - a debit or credit
card with its own rewards, such as miles or cash back.

Alternatively, for Publishers that are not Banks or Card Issuers (for
example, a third-party rewards program), this is simply a way to organize
Card Accounts.

Card Accounts may not move between Card Programs and should not be
represented in more than one Card Program.

tags.name: Data Export
tags.description:
Operations for obtaining large data sets, such as all Offer content used
by Publishers managing their own offer recommendations and transaction
matching.

tags.name: Offer Activation
tags.description:
Operations related to Activating Offers for a Customer.

Some Offers are not eligible for Rewards until a Customer activates the
Offer. Some Offers may require re-activation after a specified number of
days.

tags.name: Offer Display
tags.description:
Operations related to displaying Offers to Customers.

Offer Display will generally follow the following flow:
1. The Customer opens their mobile app or web page. A list of Recommended
   Offers are displayed to the Customer.
2. The Customer may search Offers.
3. As Offers are displayed, "Offer Viewed" Events are reported to Triple.
4. The Customer may tap or click to Activate an Offer, if required.
5. The Customer may tap or click a thumbnail to View Offer Details.

Affiliate Offers are online Offers that require redirecting the Customer
to a custom URL. The URL is specific to that Customer and is generated
by calling the "Clicks" endpoint, usually while viewing the Offer Details.

Offer Display Rules can be configured to automatically exclude offers from
the result sets.

tags.name: Offer Display Rules
tags.description:
**Alpha** - These endpoints are subject to breaking changes!

Operations used to manage rules to exclude Offers from display.

Portfolio Managers or Publishers may wish to exclude specific Merchant
Category Codes or Offers for specific Merchants.

To do this, Partners may create rules to exclude (or include) Offers based
on these criteria. Rules are scoped to either a Portfolio, Publisher, or
Card Program. When applied, include rules at any level override all
exclude rules. (An include rule does not guarantee an offer will appear in
all result sets, only that it will not be removed.)

For example, if a Publisher defines an include rule for "Bob's Hardware"
at the Publisher level and an exclude rule for hardware stores for its
"Awesome Rewards" Card Program, the only Offers for hardware stores shown
to Customers of that Card Program will be for "Bob's Hardware" (when
relevant).

tags.name: Offer Providers
tags.description:
Operations related to creating and updating Offers, Merchants, and
Merchant Locations.

tags.name: Portfolio Management
tags.description:
Operations related to managing Portfolios of Publishers.

Partners who manage Card Programs for multiple Publishers may wish to
organize those Publishers into Portfolios. Portfolios allow Offer
Exclusions to be applied across multiple Publishers without having to add
each Publisher to each Offer Exclusion.

tags.name: Rewards
tags.description: Operations for Content Providers to approve or deny Rewards.

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description:
### Overview
Operations related to reporting Transactions and checking related reward
eligibility and status.

All Transactions for Purchases and Returns must be uploaded for Card
Accounts, and Transaction amounts should not include "cash back".

### Reward Lifecycle
A Transaction that matches an Offer will go through the following stages:
- *Matching* - Triple determines whether the Transaction matches any
  active Offers and potentially meets the Offer terms.
- *Qualification* - The Merchant or Content Provider reviews matched
  Transactions and approves or denies the Reward.
- *Funding* - The Merchant or Content Provider transfers funds to pay for
  approved Rewards.
- *Distribution* - Triple sends Reward funds to the Publisher, which then
  issues the appropriate Reward (cash back, points, miles, etc.) to the
  cardholder. The Publisher then informs Triple that the cardholder has
  received the Reward.

### Automatic Creation of Card Accounts
Each Transaction uploaded to Triple must be linked to a Card Account. If a
Card Account does not exist, a best effort will be made to create one with
a "NOT_ENROLLED" status. For this to succeed, the Card Program must be
resolvable based on the external ID(s) provided in the request.

### Old Transactions
Transactions *must be uploaded within 3 days* of the transaction date to
be eligible for a Reward. Historic Transactions may be uploaded to improve
Offer Recommendations and targeting but are not eligible for Rewards.
